ygData.subject: New scenario Editor
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, Some thoughts on the new editor: Doing it as a group style project is great, if you want it open-source there are more than a few websites that can provide

Hi,
Some thoughts on the new editor:

Doing it as a group style project is great, if you want it open-source there
are more than a few websites that can provide a central storage location for
it.
I'd suggest though that a small number of people work on it, rather than
some giant group - the program itself won't be some mamoth thing and the
fewer programmers working on it the more they know the code and the faster
things get implemented/fixed/etc.  Of course this implies that the
programmers have lots of time to work on it :)

As for the language to use, I recommend C++.
You don't need to use MS Visual C++ for it, thats only the IDE.  Using
standard C++ means it will then be compileable on a wide range of compilers.
I take it the editor will be a native Win32 application, which just means
that anyone without MVC++ will need the windows platform SDK and set it up -
no big hassle, I know at least one free compiler (DJGPP) that runs in both
DOS and Windows that can do it.

I'd like to help out with development, it looks like we've already got few
others too :)
Most of the stuff I've done is available at www.twarriors.com/downloads.html
The most recent and complete is the "Timing Assistant", but the rest of them
work (they just don't have everything implemented) just fine, and one of
them has the source code available.
Aside from Win32 development I can also create a help file for the editor :)

Thats all from me,
Deathifier
